perturbation.original_text: 1.2      "Maximum Daily Quantity (MDQ) " means the maximum daily                   quantity of natural gas, expressed* in Dth's, that Transporter                   is obligated under the executed Agreement to transport on                   behalf of' Shipper, which shall be 23,000 Dth.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2      "Maximum Daily Quantity (MDQ) " means the expected daily                   quantity of natural gas, expressed* in Dth's, that Transporter                   endeavors under the executed Agreement to transport on                   behalf of' Shipper, which shall be approximately 23,000 Dth.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition states MDQ as an obligation. The modified text uses "endeavors" and "approximately", making it non-binding. This introduces a contradiction if other sections of the contract treat MDQ as a guaranteed quantity.

perturbation.original_text: 4.       Associated Natural Gas Company, a division of Arkansas Western Gas          Company ("Releasing Shipper") is a firm Shipper that is party to an          executed and valid Service Agreement with Arkansas Western Pipeline          Company under Rate Schedule FTS ("Transporter"). Releasing Shipper          proposes to release capacity as set forth below, and in accordance with          the applicable provisions of Transporter's FERC Gas Tariff. Upon the          satisfaction of all conditions applicable to the proposed release          transaction, including all applicable provisions of Section 14 of the          General Terms and Conditions of Transporter's FERC Gas Tariff,          Releasing Shipper will consent to a partial and permanent assignment of          capacity on Transporter's system. Subject to the satisfaction of such          conditions by the Releasing Shipper and the Replacement Shipper,          Transporter will consent to this partial and permanent assignment of          capacity on its system, and will waive the requirement under Section          14.7 of the General Terms and Conditions of Transporter's FERC Gas          Tariff, providing that Releasing Shipper shall remain the guarantor of          payment to Transporter of all demand charges arising under its Service          Agreement with Transporter for such assigned capacity.
perturbation.changed_text: A.       Associated Natural Gas Company, a division of Arkansas Western Gas          Company ("Releasing Shipper") is a firm Shipper that may be a party to an          executed Service Agreement with Arkansas Western Pipeline          Company under Rate Schedule FTS ("Transporter"). Releasing Shipper          may propose to release capacity as set forth below. Upon the          satisfaction of some conditions applicable to the release          transaction, Releasing Shipper may consent to a partial assignment of          capacity on Transporter's system. Subject to conditions by the Releasing Shipper,          Transporter may consent to this partial assignment of          capacity on its system, and may waive the requirement under Section          14.7 of the General Terms and Conditions of Transporter's FERC Gas          Tariff, providing that Releasing Shipper shall remain the guarantor of          payment to Transporter of all demand charges arising under its Service          Agreement with Transporter for such assigned capacity.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses definitive language ('is a firm shipper', 'will consent'). The modified text uses more ambiguous language ('may be', 'may consent'), creating uncertainty about the firm nature of the shipper's status and the commitment to release capacity. This conflicts with the expectation of firm obligations in a transportation agreement.
perturbation.location: FORM OF NOTICE OF PERMANENT RELEASE OF FIRM CAPACITY

perturbation.original_text: All written notices, requests, statements or other communications shall          be sufficiently given if mailed postage prepaid by registered,          certified, or regular mail and shall be deemed to have been duly          delivered on the third business day following the date on which same          was deposited in the United States mail, addressed in accordance with          this Article VIII. Either Shipper or Transporter may designate a          different address to which notices, requests, statements, payments or          other communications shall be sent upon proper notice as set forth in          this Article VIII.
perturbation.changed_text: All written notices, requests, statements or other communications shall be sufficiently given if mailed postage prepaid by registered or certified mail and shall be deemed to have been duly delivered on the fifth business day following the date on which same was deposited in the United States mail, addressed in accordance with this Article VIII. Either Shipper or Transporter must designate a different address to which notices, requests, statements, payments or other communications shall be sent upon proper notice as set forth in this Article VIII.
perturbation.explanation: The original allows for regular mail. The changed text removes that option and changes the deemed delivery day. Additionally, the original states 'may designate a different address' whereas the changed text states 'must'. This creates a conflict, as one definition allows for flexibility whereas the other is mandatory.
